data.title: Technology Archives
data.meta_description: jobs available in the technology industry
data.text:
Responsibilities:

• Perform analysis, design and configuration of all system components. Define Department/Clinical requirements including: SEC, Enterprise Security Groups and Rights and Environment Profile Settings.

• Provide assigned on-site support during go-lives and system upgrades.

• Ensures all quality assurance processes are followed, including change management and testing efforts.

• Partner effectively with Business Analyst to understand the client’s product-specific requirements and configuration and be able to translate them to technical design specifications and data flow from which programs are developed and coded.

• Work with Business Analysts during the software build or configuration and testing process.

• Perform technical application configuration and configure/run reports at user request.

• Design and execute unit, functional and integration test plans for new developments/releases/reports.

• Maintain technical documentation based on standard operating procedures in support of the assigned application.

• Participate in testing of software upgrades and system enhancements

• Create knowledge transfer points with other team members to improve overall team education level

• Take complete ownership for assigned projects/tasks and provide regular updates on the progress of the project/task to all stakeholders.

• Provide accurate and timely information and escalates when there are issues.

• Provide production and maintenance support for application issues.

• Identify, coordinate and communicate issues, requirements and updates related to application functionality with other team members and software vendors.

• Maintain a thorough understanding of workflow policy and procedure changes, related to the software implementation.

• Respond to help desk calls and work with clinical users to resolve issues.

• Provide on-call rotation support for the SCM and SEC application.

• Provide on-site support during Activations.

Required Experience

• Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Healthcare or another related field. Masters preferred.

• 3-5 years EMR experience in in a healthcare setting.

• Knowledge of HL7 functionality

• Proven ability to effectively communicate with all levels of staff and maintain technical documentation in a clear and concise manner.

• Strong communication skills with the ability to interact with clients

• Support 24/7 healthcare system with varying go-live schedules.

• Solid foundation of Microsoft Office

Location: New Hyde Park, NY

Salary: $110K-$122K

Contact a Recruiter at Careers On The Move

Seeking a Senior Network Engineer to be responsible for the architectural design, planning, and implementation of various networking environments.

Responsibilities:

• Required to perform analytical and technical work in the planning, design, installation and maintenance of the complex, enterprise-wide, data, voice and wireless networks. Create and maintain all technical road maps. Ensure cohesion between the various technologies and engineering projects. The Network Engineer will also ensure that the network architectural designs are consistent with the vision and roadmaps with cross infrastructure and application platforms.

• Ensure that all aspects of the telecommunications infrastructure are architecturally sound. The Network Engineer must be an expert in the internetworking field and have a strong knowledge of Cisco switches, routers and load balancers. A thorough working knowledge of LAN/WAN operations is also required. The Network Engineer will act as a subject matter expert as it relates to networking related technologies used in the COMPANY Network infrastructure, in addition to possessing a broad knowledge of applications and server-related technologies.

• Collaborate and work effectively with other Information Technology teams and resources in delivering required internetworking solutions. The Network Engineer will be required to research existing and emerging technologies that align with business requirements and will need to provide effective solutions based upon extensive professional experience, internal data, industry best practices, knowledge of industry technologies through formal training and self improvement.

• Evaluate the current network architecture and develop action plans to make necessary improvements in line with industry best practices and standards; provide input into the overall technology plan for the organization, ensuring specific technologies integrate effectively with other aspects of the technical infrastructure.

• Serve as a 3rd level technical resource to the Network Engineering/Operations teams and will also be required to provide guidance as it relates to Service Outages. They must be able to provide technical expertise to analyze, troubleshoot and react to technical issues. The ability to run data captures/decodes when necessary is a must.

• Creation of status reports, capacity reports, and overall initial trend analysis reports for the enterprise networking environment which will be used by the Operations team to provide daily support. The holder of this position will require that they comply with all established processes and procedures and also make recommendations as it relates to life cycle management of network related equipment in the production network.

Requirements:

• Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or other related field.

• Minimum three years experience in data communications fundamentals, telecommunications, network design, implementation, and support in state of the art data communications networks or an equivalent combination of education and work experience. Cisco CCIE, Cisco CCDA or CCDP certification.

• Excellent technical knowledge of VoIP/IP telephony systems, PBXs, voice mail, ACD’s, interactive voice services, call management systems, and telecommunications accounting systems, strong hands on knowledge of SIP, H.323, TCP/IP, FoIP.

• Strong understanding of VoIP, QoS issues and mitigation strategies. Cisco Load balancer or comparative vendor load balancing technologies.

• Experience with Cisco ASR’s, Catalyst 6500 series switches, 2800 series, 3800 series, 2900 series, and 3900 series routers.

• Strong CISCO Routing and Switching/Network Design.

• Understanding of TCP/IP, switching technologies (VLAN’s, STP, RSTP, VTP, 802.1x, VCP), Routing (EIGRP, BGP, redistribution, summarization), IP (subnets, CIDR, NAT, ACL’s, DNS, DHCP, WINS), VoIP, multicast protocols (PIM, IGMP, CGMP), QoS Cisco IOS, general knowledge around NTP, SNMP, Netflow, CEF, Security Protocols, network management packages including CiscoWorks, NetQos, QIP. Technical knowledge of T1, T3, Ethernet, MPLS, CWDM and DWDM.

• CCIE or CCNE certification preferred, but not required.

• Good consultative and communications skills, design skills, analytical ability, judgment, and the ability to work effectively with clients and other Information Technology staff, consultants, and vendors.

• Experience with data center converged networking based on Cisco Nexus 7000/5000/2000 architecture as well as the Nexus 1000v and Vblock.

• Experience with Cisco Unified Wireless deployments, performing site surveys, design tools, heat map generation and hardware configuration

• Knowledge of structured cable system design and implementations

• Ability to read and interpret technical documents and procedural manuals.

• On-Call participation in a rotating support schedule may be required.

Location: Bethlehem, PA

Salary: $130,000-$140,000 Plus Bonus

Contact a Recruiter at Careers On The Move

Responsibilities:

• Work under the direction of the Manager to provide technical application solutions for assigned business areas within the healthcare system.

• Manage project deliverables and communicate status, readiness plans and priorities to teams and partners

• Provide assigned on-site support during go-lives and system upgrades.

• Ensures all quality assurance processes are followed, including change management and testing efforts.

• Partner effectively with Business Analyst to understand the client’s product-specific requirements and configuration and be able to translate them to technical design specifications and data flow from which programs are developed and coded.

• Code, test, debug, implement and document moderately complex programs or technical configuration.

• Work with Business Analysts during the software build or configuration and testing process.

• Perform technical application configuration and configure /run reports at user request.

• Design and execute unit, system and integration test plans for new developments/releases/reports. –Maintain technical documentation based on standard operating procedures in support of the assigned application.

• Identify the common causes of the defects, prioritize them and systematically remove them so that they do not reoccur in further development work

• Create knowledge transfer with other team members to improve overall team education level

• Take complete ownership for the assigned task and timely inform the progress of the project / task to all stakeholders.

• Provide accurate and timely information and escalates when there are issues.

• Provide production and maintenance support for application issues.

• Identify, coordinate and communicate issues, requirements and status related to application functionality with other team members and software vendors.

Required Experience

• Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Healthcare or another related field. Masters preferred.

• 3-5 years EMR experience in in a healthcare setting.

• Proven ability to effectively communicate with all levels of staff and maintain technical documentation in a clear and concise manner.

• Strong communication skills with the ability to interact with clients

• Support 24/7 healthcare system with varying go-live schedules.

• Solid foundation of Microsoft Office

Location: New Hyde Park, NY

Salary: $100K-$113K Plus Bonus

Contact a Recruiter at Careers On The Move

Our client, an elite international electronic trading firm, has an immediate need for a driven, technically-savvy team player to help in the development, maintenance and monitoring of mission critical software components and processes.

They are seeking an exceptional Python Developer with strong skills in Java and Data Structure to join their Electronic Trading Group as they expand their highly successful, fully automated computerized trading franchise across asset classes. This role will work with the Global Data team for the electronic trading group. This is a unique opportunity for a Software Developer to become a key contributor as this data is an imperative for research and daily trading.

This hands-on position encompasses the full development cycle, from requirements collection to final deployment and includes ongoing support for internal users. In addition to experience and expertise in the field, they are also looking for maturity, intelligence, enthusiasm, versatility, and most importantly passion for technology.

Requirements:

BS, MS or PhD in Computer Science or other related field.

Minimum two to six years of related working experience

Must have a high level of expertise in Python/Perl scripting and Java

Working experience with UNIX/LINUX environments

Strong understanding of data structures, relational databases and algos

Willingness and ability to learn and use new technologies and methodologies, especially in the data structure environment

Experience solving reference data, symbology problems, as well as end-of-day data (corporate actions, closing prices, etc.) preferred

Background working with data sets (Reuters, Bloomberg Backoffice, Markit) and data vendors, preferred

Understanding of software development tools and methodologies (unit testing and version control) preferred

Location: New York, NY

Salary: Competitive

Contact a Recruiter at Careers On The Move
